text: I am thanks! @wingrove it's important to air this stuff out as we all go thru this throughout the industry & the globe. Beats "working" ;)
Those agencies don't last long term ... And if they do #@!! 'em ;)  The director's  power of "no" & "bye" takes guts but = gold  @wingrove
sadly I can count on one hand the amount of agency producers that impressed me - but those that did I cherished working with @wingrove
That's because many agencies have no backbone due to fear - that MUST change or agencies will insure their own demise @wingrove
I actually think we all work for the clients in the end.  We need to remind them that they hired us to do something they can't! @wingrove
Trust me I agree! Ever since the economic crash it's been horrible... But the economy is improving & therefore we should C change @wingrove
Merci @Naina As a director I benefit from working w/gr8t agencies & clients. We all lose when trust in one another & the process is lost
@RMurrayPhoto  I don't manage that part of the process but if there's anything I can do 2 help don't hesitate-forwarded your e-mail 2 @mzed
.@wingrove in this world of inflated egos & instant grat peeps should see that working w/ others & trust is a strength not a weakness!
I absolutely @jordy_wax I think $10-$15K is the magic barrier: anything above should likely b rented @ryanbooth @austinmann @caleglendening
If everyone accepted the boundaries of their roles & respected *trusted the process things would generally work out much better @wingrove
We're in a time where respect for each person / group & their role in the process is not being respected the way it should be :/  @wingrove
.@wingrove You know I actually have no answer for that because I've seen big name hollywood directors deal w/ the same BS in front of me...
There are few things worst than clients changing mind mid-project.  Makes entire project unsalvageable ... Sorry to hear @wingrove
